{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3109399,"name":"Hailey","username":"kds1967","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kds1967/{size}/221932_2.png","created_at":"2022-12-10T18:44:31.323Z","cooked":"

As we approach the release of CHARGED UP, KLib 2023 is here!

I would like to issue a public thank you for all the teams, people, and resources that have helped with the creation of these calculators and formulas to make this possible. Alumni/Mentors from 1902, 179, and 3512, Students from 1902, 8096, and 179. Thank you 4201, Julia, and JVN for their public calculators that I based some of these off of. I ended up adding/optimizing features, and created brand new values/formulas for every single calculator and recipe here. I hope teams find these tools useful, and I am open to feedback/suggestions on what can be added!

The Design Accelerator V4.0.1

  • Center Distance calculator can accept either belt, teeth, or center distance as an input and give you the other missing variables
  • The Piston Center Distance calculator will make it easier to sketch out piston paths, also links the McMaster part # for the selected rod-end
  • New Piston Forces sheet will remove the guess-work from deciding what piston to use in what situations
  • Bolts sheet updated to include sizes of head and drivers, alongside clearance hole and tap hole sizes
  • Shooter calculator now shows a predicted path of the ball based off of the mechanical inputs
  • Coefficient of friction reference chart added for calculating sliding forces in mechanisms
  • Vendors spreadsheet updated with new vendors, removed some old ones
  • Pneumatics charts added for more specific pneumatics calculations
  • Energy chain length calculator

The Design Accelerator does also offer non-mechanically oriented features , such as

  • Basic electronics weight, size, and mounting
  • PDH/CAN/Sensor tracking
  • PCM/Solenoid/Manifold tracking
  • The shooter calculator outputs a tolerance in RPM for hitting the goal that can be used as reference for programming if desired

The Strategy/Cycle Calculator V2

  • This calculator works off of a custom variable that was developed called the Robot Probability Factor, or RPF for short. The RPF compares your robot’s perfect performance to what it actually did on the field. Doing this allows us to gain a % in time increase for each team. I’ve noticed that on 1902 our team’s RPF value doesn’t really change from year to year. So by using this percentage, we can take our theoretical robot design and be able to see where we’ll stack up against other teams before even building it

Inventor Parts Library V4.0

  • Nothing REALLY changed with this from last year, some new REV Ion products were added alongside TTB/WCP stuff, but the additions were minimal. I’ve placed this on the back burner for now because I can help many more teams with the spreadsheets as opposed to a parts library only a few teams can actually use. A few extra mechanism generators were added for bumpers and swerve as well

Inventor Parts Library, V4.0
The largest FRC-based parts Library for Autodesk Inventor Professional 2023 users
https://tinyurl.com/klibpartslib

Design Accelerator, V4.0.1
The ultimate one-stop shop for FRC robot design
https://tinyurl.com/klibdesign401

Strategy/Cycle Calculator, V2
A real world, performance predicting cycle calculator
https://tinyurl.com/klibstratcalc2
